chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Cody A Vanderhei was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01:46 PM Defendant Cody A Vanderhei in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas J. Schneck.    Kevin Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cody A Vanderhei appeared by video means with Attorney.
Attorney Osborne makes statements to the court indicating that Dr. Lundbohm could not appear in person today, but can testify by phone.  Attorney Schneck does not object to Dr. Lundbohm appearing by phone.
Although the court did want Dr. Lunbohm to appear in person to testify, she is allowed to appear by phone. 
Dr. Brooke Lundbohm is sworn in and tested.  ADA Osborne questions witness on direct examination.
Attorney Schneck questions witness on cross examination.
Court questions witness. 
Court hears arguments from the parties on the petition for conditional release.
For reasons as stated on the record, the court denies the petition for conditional release.
Affidavit of Services for Court ordered psychological evaluation and billing statement, received and filed, by Behavioral Consultants, Inc.
Review hearing on June 18, 2019 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cody A Vanderhei in court with attorney Andrew Ladd for Attorney Thomas J. Schneck.   Kevin Osbourne and District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
